memberFunctions.name: order_by
memberFunctions.summary: Orders the results of the contained subquery by a precedence list of variables
examples:
let [A, B, C] = vars("A", "B", "C")
WOQL.order_by(A, [B, "asc"], [C, "desc"]).triple(A, B, C);

parameters.name: varNames
parameters.summary:
A sequence of variables,
by which to order the results,
each optionally followed by either “asc” or “desc” to represent order as a list, by default
it will sort the variable in ascending order

returns.summary: A WOQLQuery which contains the ordering expression

memberFunctions.name: group_by
memberFunctions.summary:
Groups the results of the contained subquery on the basis of identical values for Groupvars,
extracts the patterns defined in PatternVars and stores the results in GroupedVar
examples:
//subquery is an argument or a chained query
let [age, last_name, first_name, age_group, person] = vars("age", "last name", "first name",
"age group", "person")
group_by(age, [last_name, first_name], age_group)
  .triple(person, "first_name", first_name)
  .triple(person, "last_name", last_name)
  .triple(person, "age", age)

parameters.name: varList
parameters.summary: Either a single variable or an array of variables

parameters.name: patternVars
parameters.summary: Either a single variable or an array of variables

parameters.name: resultVarName
parameters.summary: output variable name

parameters.name: subquery
parameters.summary: The query whose results will be grouped

returns.summary: A WOQLQuery which contains the grouping expression

memberFunctions.name: path
